TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit CommaDelimitedStringCollection extends System.Collections.Specialized.StringCollection
Public NotInheritable Class CommaDelimitedStringCollection Inherits StringCollection

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of string elements separated by commas. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This class represents a string collection that is serialized as a comma-delimited list of string elements.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection> type.

Docs.summary: Adds a string to the comma-delimited collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method causes the <xref:System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection.IsModified%2A> property to be set to `true`.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void AddRange(string[] range) cil managed

Docs.param: An array of strings to add to the collection.
Docs.summary: Adds all the strings in a string array to the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `range` parameter must be an array rather than a comma-delimited string.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IsModified As Boolean
public: property bool IsModified { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether the collection has been modified.
Docs.value: if the has been modified; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection.IsModified%2A> property is `true` after the <xref:System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection.Add%2A>, <xref:System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection.Clear%2A>, <xref:System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection.Insert%2A>, or <xref:System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection.Remove%2A> method has been called. Also, the <xref:System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection.IsModified%2A> property is `true` after the <xref:System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection.Item%2A> property is used to modify an element of the string collection.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection.IsModified%2A> property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection> class overview.
[!code-csharp[System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection/CS/CommaDelimitedStringCollection.cs#7)] [!code-vb[System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection/VB/CommaDelimitedStringCollection.vb#7)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IsReadOnly As Boolean
public: property bool IsReadOnly { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the collection object is read-only.
Docs.value: if the specified string element in the is read-only; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property returns `true` if the collection is marked as read-only. This is useful for protecting the element at run time, as opposed to design time. For more information, see the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement.IsReadOnly%2A> method on the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement?displayProperty=nameWithType> class.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection.IsReadOnly%2A> property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection> class overview.

Docs.param: The index of the string element in the collection.
Docs.summary: Gets or sets a string element in the collection based on the index.
Docs.value: A string element in the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property allows a string in the collection to be set or retrieved based on its index in the collection. This property also causes the <xref:System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection.IsModified%2A> property to be set to `true`.
